summary: "Layla and Majnun" is an ancient Arab love story about Qays and Layla, who fell in love as kids. When they grew up, Layla's dad said no to their relationship, and Qays became known as "Majnun" (meaning "crazy"). The Persian poet Nizami made this story famous with his poem in the 12th century. Many other poets copied his style, creating their own versions. The tale spread to different countries and languages, with people loving the romantic adventure. Even today, you can find modern adaptations of this classic love story.
title: Layla and Majnun
